paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.demographics: Patients with gynecological cancer, specific demographics not detailed.
patients.phenotype: Most mutations found in patients with ovarian cancer (OC).

functional_data.summary: BRCA2 mutation c.2307delT p.I770Ffs*2 was identified as a hotspot among Chinese patients.

variants.segregation_data: The frequency of germline BRCA2 mutations was higher than somatic mutations.
variants.evidence_level: Moderate evidence based on frequency in patients with OC.
variants.additional_notes: No specific functional assays or in vitro studies mentioned.
key_quotes: A new mutation hotspot in BRCA2 (I770) was firstly discovered among Chinese patients with gynecological cancer.
Moreover, the frequency of germline BRCA2 mutations (11/19, 57.89%) was higher than that of BRCA1 mutations.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding BRCA2 variants were extracted successfully.
